definition: to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: To support the children, Granny gets up early every day to work on her farm.
sentences.chinese: 为了扶养孙儿，阿嬷每天一大早起床到农场工作。

sentences.english: Brown's offer to pay your client a thousand dollars a month for child support.
sentences.chinese: 布朗愿意每个月付一千美元的子女扶养费。

sentences.english: He has a wife and family depending on him.
He had three children to support.
The court presumes the maintenance payments are being paid on time.
sentences.chinese: 法院推定扶养费是按时支付的。

sentences.english: Supporting a family is becoming more and more difficult these days.
sentences.chinese: 这年头要扶养一个家庭越来越不容易了。

sentences.english: I was brought up by my paternal aunt.
As adults, children of this generation lack the inclination to support their parents.
sentences.chinese: 这一代的孩子成年后缺乏扶养老人的意识。

sentences.english: The payments were made according to the maintenance order.
sentences.chinese: 按法院扶养令进行了付款。

sentences.english: Tom was a heel for refusing support his foster mother.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是个孽子，因为他拒绝扶养他的养母。

definition: to support/to provide support for/to maintain
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
